group_1.narration: After Miss Purrs disappeared,@I stopped wandering around the city.@I stayed at school even after class was over.
My classmates had club activities,@or went out with their friends.
I'd search for an empty@classroom to pass the time...
That was when I made a friend.
I'd finish up my homework for English@class in one of those empty classrooms.
Somewhere I knew no one would be,@where I could be alone...
I put my [textRed:Mr. Purrs-a-lot]@keychain on the desk to@try to ward off the loneliness.

group_1.textCenter: That homework took longer than I thought...
Mr. Purrs-a-lot, we'd better get going.@The sun's already starting to set...

group_1.narration: I knew it was time to go home, but@I couldn't lift my head from the desk.
I hated going home. I wanted@to put it off as long as I could.
Every day lately has been like this.

group_1.textCenter: Time to head home, I guess...

group_1.narration: And with that, I finally got up.@That's when I heard a voice.

group_1.textRight: I-I'm really sorry! I didn't, umm, mean to...

group_1.textLeft: Um... Who are you? I mean, it's nice to@meet you.

group_1.narration: She was in the same class as me.
She was a very quiet student, never@attracting any attention at school...@Just like me...
Why would a girl like this@talk to me out of nowhere?@I soon found out.

group_1.textRight: Sana... Um...@D-do you like Mr. Purrs-a-lot?
M-me too... I like Mr. Purrs-a-lot so much!

group_1.narration: That was how, for the first time ever,@someone actually walked up and talked to me.
Once we started talking,@I realized she was also lonely.
But my Mr. Purrs-a-lot keychain gave@her the courage to talk to me.
Thanks to him...@I made my first friend.

group_1.textLeft: I-I've had this keychain since I was a little@girl!

group_1.narration: For the first time in my life,@I made a [textRed:friend at school].
